conbody.p: Phones are the main unit of an IPA transcription. They are composed of a vowel or consonant along with optional prefix, combining, length, suffix, and tone diacritics. The following sections outline each part of a single Phone.

section.title: Prefix Diacritic
section.p: A prefix diacritic must appear before the base glyph.

section.title: Base Glyph
section.p: The base glyph can be any IPA vowel or consonant.

section.title: Combining Diacritic(s)
section.p: Combining diacritics must appear directly after the base glyph; any number of combining diacritics may be used.

section.title: Length
section.p: Phone length is indicated using character 0x02D0 (long) and 0x02D1 (half-long.) Up to three long diacritics may be included within a phone.

section.title: Suffix Diacritic
section.p: A suffix diacritic must appear after the base glyph, combining diacritics and length if applicable.

section.title: Tone
section.p: Tone diacritics (such as upstep or tone numbers) must appear as the last element in a phone.

section.note: Please consult for a list of possible IPA elements and their character types.
